channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Issue still ongoing with fly tipping., 13th August
item.description:
You closed my last report concerning this dishwasher which was fly tipped. I am unsatisfied with your response. Who is the non-local authority or privately owned/operated organisation responsible for removing this item? (I have CCTV evidence of exactly who did the fly tipping). I understand that fly tipping is a criminal offence so please advise what I, a private resident, need to do to resolve this matter if you feel it is not within your jurisdiction.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 110-112, Tower Bridge Road, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple shopping trolleys dumped on pavement, 13th August
item.description:
Multiple shopping trolleys vandalised and dumped blocking the pavement and looking unsightly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Halcot Avenue, Barnehurst, London

item.title: Bikes and scooters on the Narrow Way, 13th August
item.description:
The Narrow Way is an absolute nightmare. Had to dodge Lime Bikes and delivery scooters the whole time. I thought this was supposed to be a pedestrian area. If bikes are going to use the area why not put in a dedicated cycle lane.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mare Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish / fly tipping attracting rodents, 13th August
item.description:
There is rubbish being dumped at the rear of 22 mare street on a regular basis and this is leading to rodents and rotting food waste. Please can this be cleared by hackney council. Thank you

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mare Street, Hackney, London

item.title: The bins are left in street and attract rubbish overfilling making pavement impassable, 13th August
item.description:
The bins that should be in the alleyway are kept on the street as the pizza place wants to keep their delivery bikes off street. The consequence of this is that bins block half the pavement. Rubbish overfill blocks the pavement completely. It also attracts fly tipping of rubbish The end of this road is generally littered and unpassable
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Vestry Road, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loads of litter and abandoned clothes in the park, 13th August
item.description:
It looks like somebody's been sleeping in this cute little pocket park behind the cut. There's lots of litter and what looks like someone's stuff behind the benches. Thrres also lots of litter on the floor. Very sad because it's a great place for lunch.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Cut, Southwark, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The wait bitton outside pilates studio is breaking, 13th August
item.description:
Sometimes pressing the wait button outside the pilates studio works I.e. the light is lit and pedestrian signal goes green in turn but sometimes it does light up. Then the traffic does not pause and it is dangerous to cross. It seems to fail in the evening, as if a timed software fault, but it could be the switch needs renewing only
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 54, High Street, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 4 Summers close NW1 1RT, 13th August
item.description:
Resident reports tree branches touching window and squirrels are now jumping onto window ledge
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Platt Street, Somers Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Disgraceful eyesore, 13th August
item.description:
Seemingly abandonded construction around the corner of Bell Yard Mews/Bermondsey Street next to Fuckcoffee. There has been a 6ft cupboard flytipped there, bin bags of waste regularly sitting there and the pavement itself is loose, and impeded by the appalling construction furniture which has not been worked on for months. it is a hotspot for flytipping, a physical mess and hazardous to walk by alone. If someone else is coming towards you, someone has to walk in the street. An accident waiting to happen.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 159, Bermondsey Street, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipped mixed waste on Thames path behind galleon close on corinthian manorway, past supposed security gate, 13th August
item.description:
Mixed dumped items (previously included asbestos) dumped by bearded male from a shopping trolley. Just past the "security gate" leading to the Thames path on corinthian manorway, just behind galleon close.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Corinthian Manorway, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet
